author: schwartz.alexander.j
title: Integrating Python & NFT usability
description: Integrating Cardano NFTs into functional web 2 social media platforms. Easy Drag, and verify code for all users. Friendly Codeless user face

f6_assessments.q0: Even though the proposal is surely an attention grabber, there is not enough material evidence to conclude its justice to the challenge it is submitted under. The name of the proposal and the solution the proposer is presenting has some discrepancy and is not quite clear. I personally feel the problem of not having a good UI/Ux experience in web3 applications needs to be addressed and rectified rather than falling back to web2 application support. The need of integrating the NFT and its verification over social media might be exciting, but the criticality of the project is not very urgent and we have plenty of other genuine problems across the Cardano chain that needs immediate attention. And with no clue as to what the proposer is trying to solve, it's very hard to evaluate the impact and the community needs to be heedful regarding this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer keeps the proposal very compact, thus, making it a little tough for the readers and the community to understand how the team proposes to tackle the problem. The team mentions no clear deliverables to look forward to. The fund requested is very hefty and can not be justified until and unless the proposer provides a detailed breakdown of how and where the funds will be utilized. And the proposer pays no attention to providing information about the flavor of the team designated to work on this idea, to the community and there's no viable way to assess the experience and the capabilities of the team. With no clear action plan or team, the community needs to be wary about the proposal's chances of successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: With a lot of lacking details, it's quite hard for anyone to track the direction the proposal is headed. Lack of facts regarding the prior groundwork and research is not helping the proposal's credibility in any way. In addition to that, the success definition and KPIs that the auditors could use are missing, hence the auditing process could turn out to be full of complications and tedious. The successful outcomes of the proposal do not match any of the challenge's requirements and look very feeble. So I suggest the user returns to their meeting rooms and jot down a verifiable plan and come back with a stronger manifesto in the upcoming rounds and the current one isn't supporting their passion or their aspirations.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea presented in the proposal is both interesting and have good use cases today, in other words it’s a relevant idea that aligns with the challenge setting and it contributes to widen the Cardano ecosystem. However, the assessments focuses on the proposals and this proposal must be considered incomplete. It's like the team had a great idea but came unprepared to the assignment. The proposal fails to give any real details more than the vision of your project and empty promises about what you will deliver in the future if you get funded. For example, the roadmap should be constructed and presented in the proposal. It is hard to deem the proposal credible in its current state. The proposers should review their proposal and take a look at other successful proposals from previous funds to gain inspiration of how they ideally should be structured. 
All in all, the idea is interesting and relevant but the proposal is not complete, therefore a score of 3-stars will be given. Hopefully we'll see you in the next fund with an awesome proposal!
f6_assessments.q1: The team claims to have the right knowledge and tools to build the proposed solution, there's no way to verify this. Although, given the scope of the project 1 star will be added to the score for this claim. Other than that, the proposal is incomplete and there's no way to tell if the project is feasible or not. Score given: 2-stars.
f6_assessments.q2: This section is empty in 2 of 3 headings, as well as very general in the third. This has to be addressed in the future in order to have a chance of getting funded. As mentioned earlier, look at previous successful proposals within this challenge setting for inspiration. Score given: 1-star.

f6_assessments.q0: The main goal of this proposal is to use Python and C# to import NFTs from sources into the Web 2 experience. The challenge appears to be rather ambiguous, as the proposer states "web 2 social media platforms" in the problem statement before moving on to a solution of "web 3 interface." Furthermore, due to a lack of critical information, such as a roadmap with a deadline and KPIs/metrics for monitoring progress, the solution remains abstract. As a result, I disagree the impact of this idea.
f6_assessments.q1: As can be observed, this proposal has no information about the proposers, making it difficult to assess its feasibility. In fact, we were unable to discover any information about the demo that had been provided. Furthermore, I don't see any goal/target, KPIs/metrics, plan, or budget breakdown-one of the most fundamental things to consider when evaluating feasibility from this side. I was confused because it seemed like this proposal didn't provide any risk. In conclusion, I strongly disagree with this proposal's possible
f6_assessments.q2: It is clear that we are unable to identify any information on the team, making it difficult to assess its feasibility. Second, there is no indication that a roadmap exists in this proposal. It's odd that no Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) or Metrics have been established (Metrics). We only find out the overall budget, no information about how they break down it. As a result, I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement considered here is "Integrating Cardano NFTs into functional web 2 social media platforms. Easy Drag, and verify code for all users. Friendly Codeless user face". The solution proposed is based on an assumption that and easy to use codeless verification means/platform for this purpose will be developed. It is great idea in this space but this in particular is a very generalized solution for the chosen problem and, there are already numerous community/organizations in cardano currently working on this particular issue, and the details regarding what particular product will be developed and details regarding its implementation is missing  in the proposal details.The proposed application on its own has only limited impact when it comes as a Dapp idea as of now with the missing details, with the details and voids between the idea and the implementation filled in this can be great proposal in upcoming rounds with details regarding roadmap and specific plan for the platform/interface detailed down in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: As mentioned in the impact details the missing gap between the solution proposed being "integrating a supreme codeless verification for users into web 2" and the actual implementation/execution is rather high to evaluate whether this particular solution will be developed be the team. The presented solution is comprehensible but I think it is important to have more clarity in the description of what the membership model is and its relevance in the proposal. I think it is important to describe how this will be done in more detail to better understand the approach. The proposal mentions the team consists of develpers who will be working on this proposed solution however further details on technical/non technical expertise and exposure relevant to development and successful delivery of this solution would have been great.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has more of a generalized idea of the solution proposed to impact and solve the problem statement chosen and yet has a number of details and voids to be figured out and added into proposal to assess the impact and successful implementation of the project. The proposer can go through the community guidelines for further details on what and how more relevant information can be put into the proposal for effective approach for the fund round. As the proposer has mentioned if they can provide a well defined roadmap for execution and implementation of the proposed solution it  would be much impactful and informative proposal and can be applied for in upcoming funding rounds. There are important key information sections missing or weakly described such as milestones, fund break up, timeline and further fund requirement details which be added on the future proposals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer aims to integrate CNFT’s into the current social media platforms. The rest of the problem statement is unclear. “Easy Drag, and verify code for all users” and “Friendly Codeless user face” are not explained. I would suggest that more detail is given so that the assessors does not have to guess what are meant by these statements. The proposer should also indicate which social media platforms will be targeted seeing that Meta is on course to integrate NFT’s on Facebook and Instagram. NFTs and social media attracts lots of developers but no confidence is given due to the lack articulation in this proposal.
The proposer only promised a fully open-source github repo but did not provide and details or links.
f6_assessments.q1:
No information about the team or individual is given. No links to projects were provided. It is only stated that the team/individual has 15 years of Python, SQL and database experience and that (s)he is a “top” FANG employee. The proposer should have himself and/or team members with links to their socials and track records to inspire confidence. 
An amount of US115,000 is requested but there is no budget breakdown. A detailed costing broken down into all items should be added to the proposal in order for it to be assessed for reasonability. 
The fact that no team and budget information has been given, and no challenges and risks has been identified, I do not see that this proposal will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are no milestones provided and only a promise of a one year roadmap. No KPI’s are mentioned. No way of tracking of how the project is coming along has been indicated. 
The proposer has a lot do to add credibility to this proposal. A clear road map needs to be added detailing what will be done and when. KPI’s needs to be identified and show how they will be measured. A way of tracking progress needs to be shown. For example stats on a website or on Github. 
Since none of the above were provided, I do not see this proposal being implemented successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement does not make clear the core of the problem to be solved in this proposal, but it was possible to understand through the context. I would recommend that the problem statement field be used more efficiently, making the problem clearer.

The suggested solution could contribute to solving users' UI/UX in the context of NFTs on web2 platforms and the concept would be within the scope of this challenge.

The problem is that this proposal is still a draft. No concrete plan was included. There are no metrics/KPIs to assess the potential impact of the proposal on the challenge.

I would recommend that the proposer use the following documentation (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oE_cnP0gksdAanXV4w5DYaDNp_tbYEvyHhTUG4HYZ3Q/edit?disco=AAAAG42-Ypk&usp_dm=true) as a reference to design a new proposal, including elements that help in the indication of impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is not enough information to assess the team's expertise. Some experiences related to Python, SQL and C# development have been mentioned but there is no source to verify. There are no links to repositories or Linkedin, which compromises the feasibility assessment.

There is no plan. There is no schedule, roadmap or budget breakdown. A relevant risk was considered, but no solution was suggested.

This proposal is still a draft. I would recommend that the proposer use the following documentation as a reference for writing a new proposal: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oE_cnP0gksdAanXV4w5DYaDNp_tbYEvyHhTUG4HYZ3Q/edit?disco=AAAAG42-Ypk&usp_dm=true
f6_assessments.q2:
In the field "problem statement" there is no clarity on the problem presented, although it is possible to understand by reading the proposal, I would recommend that the proposer include a more detailed rationale explaining the problem in the challenge brief.

There is no roadmap, no timeline, no milestones. Metrics/KPIs were not included.

The lack of these items compromises the auditability of the proposal. I would recommend that the proposer use the following documentation as a reference for writing a new proposal, including auditability items: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oE_cnP0gksdAanXV4w5DYaDNp_tbYEvyHhTUG4HYZ3Q/edit?disco=AAAAG42-Ypk&usp_dm=true

f6_assessments.q0:
The main point of this proposal is importing NFTs via sources into the web 2 experience by using Python, and C#. As provided by this proposer, the problem seems to be quite vague, because limited information provided. Furthermore, the solution stays abstract due to the lack of vital information, such as a roadmap with a timeline, KPIs/metrics for measuring success.
As a result, I strongly disagree with this proposal's impact
f6_assessments.q1:
As one can see, this proposal lacks context about the proposers [only described as "15 years at a Fang company" and "SQL, Python, and C#"], making it very difficult to assess its feasibility. In addition, the proposer did not provide any information that show their demo/pilot/prototype/similar works completed in the past. As a consequence of the shortage of a target/goals, indicators/measures, timeline, or budget breakdown in this proposal, it is hard to assess feasibility from this viewpoint. Risk is not provided, this shows that the proposer has not fully looked at what could happen during the implementation of this proposal.
As a result, based on the provided information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's feasibility
f6_assessments.q2:
As could be shown, this plan has little or no info about the proposers [as mentioned above], making it difficult to assess its feasibility. Secondly, there is no road map, no KPIs/metrics in place. Additionally, this proposal did not provide the budget structure with cost items, only the total budget of $115k.
As a result, based on the information provided, I can give this proposal's auditability only 1 point. I hope this proposer will improve and complete this potential idea in the future.

solution: UX/UI web 3 interfaces have not been a great visual experience. My team is integrating a supreme codeless verification for users into web 2
experience: 15 years of Python SQL, and database experience. top fang employee.
